sentences.text: LETTER FROM THE CHAIRMAN AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER TO OUR SHAREHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Shareholder
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We invite you to attend the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of The PNC Financial Services Group, Inc. on Tuesday, April 25, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meeting will be held in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania in the James E. Rohr Auditorium in The Tower at PNC Plaza, 300 Fifth Avenue, beginning at 11:00 a.m., Eastern time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will consider the matters described in this proxy statement and also review significant developments since last years meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are again making our proxy materials available to you electronically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hope that this continues to offer you convenience while allowing us to reduce the number of copies that we print.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy statement contains important information and you should read it carefully.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the meeting in person, we strongly encourage you to designate the proxies named on the proxy card to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you will not be there in person, you will be able to listen to the meeting by webcast or conference call.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the notice that follows for more information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look forward to your participation and thank you for your support of PNC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 15, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: William S. Demchak Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer

sentences.text: Item 3:  Say-on-pay (page 83)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We ask shareholders to cast a non-binding advisory vote on our executive compensation program  known generally as the say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have offered an annual say-on-pay vote since 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, 97% of the votes cast by our shareholders supported our executive compensation program, and PNC has averaged 92% support in its say-on-pay votes over the past five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recommend that you read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) (beginning on page 38), which explains how and why our Boards Personnel and Compensation Committee made executive compensation decisions for 2016.

sentences.text: Item 4:  Frequency of say-on-pay (page 85)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We ask shareholders to cast a non-binding advisory vote on the frequency of future votes on our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After our shareholders voted in 2011 recommending that we hold an annual say-on-pay vote, the Board affirmed that recommendation and elected to hold future say-on-pay votes on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are once again soliciting input from our shareholders on how frequently we should hold a say-on-pay vote in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote for a say-on-pay vote to be held every one, two or three years, or you may abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends that you vote FOR a frequency of ONE YEAR for future advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 PNC performance (page 38)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered consistent results in a challenging operating environment, with net income of approximately $4.0 billion and diluted earnings per common share of $7.30.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grew net interest income despite the low interest rate environment, and we increased our fee income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grew deposits and loans and managed our loan portfolio within our desired risk appetite.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintained strong capital and liquidity positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered value for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our one-year total shareholder return (TSR) was 25.8% and our three-year TSR was 17.3%, which was the highest in our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We met our continuous improvement goal of $400 million in expense savings and continued to keep our noninterest expenses stable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to execute against our strategic priorities of building a leading banking franchise in our underpenetrated markets, capturing more investable assets, reinventing the retail banking experience, and bolstering critical infrastructure and streamlining core processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We returned more than $3 billion in capital to our shareholders through share repurchases and common stock dividends, including raising the quarterly common stock dividend.

sentences.text: In this section, we describe the NYSE independence standards for directors and our Board-adopted independence guidelines.

sentences.text: Director independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board must affirmatively determine that a director does not have a material relationship with PNC for the director to be independent under NYSE rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A material relationship between a director and PNC could also include a relationship between PNC and an organization affiliated with a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An employee-director of PNC (or a director with an immediate family member who is a PNC executive officer) will not be independent until three years after the employment relationship ends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The other bright-line tests will impair independence if they existed at any time within the past three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NYSE rules describe specific relationships that will always impair independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The absence of one of these bright- line relationships does not mean that a director is automatically independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board must consider all relevant facts and circumstances in determining whether a material relationship exists.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More information about the NYSEs bright-line director independence tests, including the commentary explaining the application of the tests, can be found on the NYSEs website at www.nyse.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board guidance on independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To help assess whether a material relationship exists, our Board adopted guidelines that describe four categories of relationships that will not be considered material.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a relationship meets the criteria outlined in this guidance, it will not be deemed to be a material relationship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This guidance can be found in our corporate governance guidelines on our website at www.pnc.com/corporategovernance.

sentences.text: The Board may then affirm a directors independence without further analysis of this relationship, provided that the director otherwise meets the other relevant independence tests.

sentences.text: Capital and risk metrics      Economic capital    Economic capital represents the capital that we should hold against unexpected losses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Economic capital serves as a common currency of risk that allows us to compare different risks on a similar basis across our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return on economic capital (ROEC) vs. cost of capital    ROEC is our annualized net income divided by our economic capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comparing our profits to how much capital we are holding against potential losses helps to provide a risk-based evaluation of profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When we compare ROEC to our cost of capital  that is, a minimum rate of return on the overall capital that we hold  it provides a good measure of the excess value that we provide to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tier 1 risk-based capital ratio    The Tier 1 risk-based capital ratio is used by banking regulators to assess the capital adequacy and financial strength of a bank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This capital ratio must exceed 6% for PNC to be considered well- capitalized by our regulators.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expense metrics      Efficiency ratio    The efficiency ratio helps us evaluate how efficiently we operate our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratio divides our noninterest expense (such as compensation and benefits, occupancy costs, equipment, and marketing) by our revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, a smaller ratio is better.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A banks efficiency ratio will be affected, however, by its particular mix of businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Profitability metrics      Earnings per share (EPS)    EPS is a common metric used by investors to evaluate the profitability of a company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It shows the earnings (net income) we make on each outstanding share of common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EPS growth    While EPS represents a specific dollar amount, EPS growth represents the percentage growth of EPS since last year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EPS growth helps us to compare our annual earnings strength to our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return on assets (ROA)    Investors often evaluate banks by their asset size, with loans and investment securities making up the largest components of assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROA is our annualized net income divided by our average assets and represents how efficiently we use assets to generate profit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return on common equity    Return on common equity is our annualized net income attributable to our common shareholders divided by average common shareholders equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It shows how efficiently we use our investor funds (common equity) to generate profit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue metrics      Net interest income    Net interest income measures the revenue generated from lending and other activities minus all interest expenses (such as interest paid on deposits and borrowings).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is a good indicator of performance for banks given the importance of interestearning assets and interestbearing sources of funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Noninterest income    Noninterest income measures the fees and other revenue we derive from our businesses (other than interest income).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A healthy mix of net interest income and noninterest income provides diverse earnings streams and lessens a banks reliance on the interest rate environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Valuation metrics      Tangible book value per share    This non-GAAP financial measure takes our total tangible common shareholders equity (intangible assets, such as goodwill, are excluded) and divides that by the number of shares outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This provides investors with an objective valuation method and allows them to compare relative values of similar companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total shareholder return (TSR)    TSR is a common metric used to show the total returns to an investor in our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual TSR takes into account the change in stock price from the beginning to the end of the year, as well as the reinvestment of any dividends issued throughout the year.

sentences.text: You will have an opportunity to ask questions or make comments about each Agenda item as it is addressed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your questions or comments must pertain to the Agenda item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have scheduled a general question and answer session at the conclusion of the meeting to discuss matters not on the Agenda, but appropriate for discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Procedures for Speaking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only shareholders or their proxies may be heard during the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ask a question or make a comment, please raise your hand and wait to be recognized by the Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All questions or comments must be addressed to the Chairman, once a microphone has been passed to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please give your name and state whether you are a shareholder or a proxy for a shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Speaking out of turn or interfering when another speaker has the floor is prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After a shareholder has spoken, the Chairman may respond personally or designate another person to respond.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. Speaker Rotation and Time Limits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman may limit questions to one at a time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who wish to speak will be recognized on a rotating basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please keep your comments brief in order to give other shareholders the opportunity to speak.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may speak for up to two minutes on a particular matter and no one person may speak for more than six minutes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. Other Limitations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman may refuse to permit a nomination or proposal to be made by a shareholder who has not complied with applicable laws or rules, or the procedures set forth in PNCs By-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman may end discussion if it appears that the matter has been adequately addressed, or is not appropriate, or for other reasons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal matters are not appropriate for discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of PNC will be available following the meeting to address individual shareholder concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rudeness, personal attacks, comments in bad taste, and the injection of irrelevant controversy are not permitted at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7. Mobile Devices, Recording Devices, and Briefcases
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No cameras, mobile phones, laptops, tablets, or recording equipment are permitted in the meeting room.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, large bags, backpacks, briefcases, and similar items are not permitted in the meeting room.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A staffed coat check for personal belongings is available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8. Safety and Security
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A sergeant at arms and/or local law enforcement will be present to enforce compliance with these Regulations for Conduct and all applicable laws at the direction of the Chairman, including removal of noncompliant attendees, as necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Weapons are not permitted in the meeting room and may not be checked in the staffed coat room.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of an emergency, exit the doors at the front of the room.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Failure to comply with these Regulations for Conduct or otherwise impeding a fair and orderly meeting may be grounds for removal from the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of Shareholders is audio-recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
